channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Judges Walk of Lower Terrace, 28th November
item.description:
Contractors working on Summit Lodge are using the public green area @ Judges Walk to park their trucks and have churned up grass, etc leaving this attractive public area looking a mess.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Terrace, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tent pitched behind trees (possibly someone living in it), 28th November
item.description:
There has been a blue tent pitched behind the trees for some weeks now, with signs that someone might be living in it... lots of rubbish and other items accumulating around the entrance. This is next to the football pitches. Only reporting this in the hope that if someone needs support with accommodation they can get it, as the weather is now so cold and the park doesn't have toilets or other vital facilities they might need.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cator Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A 2.25 meter near the Bursted Wood Surgery, 28th November
item.description:

item.title: Dumped glass TV unit and cardboard on street, 28th November
item.description:
The TV unit includes large sheets of glass, just waiting for someone to break it. The top piece is also loose. There is also a large cardboard box, which all passers by are using as a rubbish bin. The street is looking like the neighbourhoods dumping ground all over again. Especially with the mud from the construction and the moldy leaves on the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Ridsdale Road, Anerley, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog diarrhoea, 28th November
item.description:
Multiple wet dog poos on downs lane covered in leaves

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Downs Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cporner of mulberry way - lots of household furniture, rubbish & rubble dumped, 28th November
item.description:
Resident reporting on the corner and on the pavement there is a lot of household items, mattress, suitcases, plant pots dumped and underneath there is a lot of rubble which is going to be heavy to take away for crew. Resident is also reporting there are family photographs and papers dumped on the pavement, (this could be evidence, Please could someone look into asap). Resident is a dog walker and has to go into the road to avoid the fly-tipping and has dog jumps out and the cars come out fast on the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mulberry Way, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Person loitering on stairs while smoking, 28th November
item.description:
Claris Court, 13 Harcourt Street Random guy lying/sitting on floor at the bottom of stairs (ground floor), next to parked Santander bike. Not sure what he was doing, stuff around him. Smell of string smoke. Cleaning crew in building, maybe they know? Felt insecure, and as front door often left open, the guy could be trespassing ? Anyhow no smoking should happen in the building and bikes should be parked outside. Please investigate
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bradenham Close, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
